text.p: Heartstream Inc said Tuesday it expects first quarter revenues of $1.0-$1.3 million, and a net loss per share of $0.35 to $0.38.
Longer-than-expected customer decision-making processes and smaller evaluation orders led to lower-than-anticipated sales during the quarter, it said.
The company plans to release full results for the quarter on April 17.
For the first quarter of 1996, the company reported a net loss of $2.1 million, or $0.25 per share.

Alan Levy, president and chief executive officer, said that while Heartstream was encouraged by initial sales of ForeRunner AED product, it believes the timing involved with actual purchases may take longer than originally anticipated.
Heartstream makes and markets automatic external defibrillators for the treatment of sudden cardiac arrest.
